info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued June 09 at 4:09PM AST until June 12 at 1:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Prolonged periods of dangerously hot temperatures and high humidity likely with heat indices of 108 degrees Fahrenheit or more. * WHERE...along the northeast, eastern, southern and southwest urban and coastal areas of Puerto Rico. * WHEN....For the Excessive Heat Advisory, through 5 PM AST today. For the Excessive Heat Watch through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will create dangerous situations in which heat related illnesses are likely.
info.instruction: A Heat Advisory means that a period of hot temperatures is expected. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a situation in which heat illnesses are possible. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 9 1 1.
